attributes.action: Warrington borough council to give deduction on council tax due to bin strikes.
attributes.additional_details: As residents of Warrington we want a deduction to our council tax payments as many of us are suffering because of the Warrington bin strikes.  We are paying a percentage of council tax for our rubbish to be removed yet many of us are having to pay for skips and trips to the recycling centres using our fuel for this which again is more funds out of our pockets. It’s now going into December strikes with November and October already having strikes and no bins collected. It’s absolutely disgusting.
attributes.background: As residents of Warrington we want a deduction to our council tax payments due to bin strikes affecting us through October, November and going into December. Rubbish mounting up outside, rats, spending money for skips and fuel trips to the recycling centre. Something needs to be done about this.

rejection.details: You may wish to contact your local council. You can find out how to do so here: https://www.gov.uk/find-local-council
